meanings.definition: A large, powerful computer used mainly by large organizations for critical applications, typically bulk data processing such as census, industry and consumer statistics, enterprise resource planning, and financial transaction processing.
meanings.sent1: The mainframes at the bank handle all the financial transactions efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Many big companies rely on mainframes to process huge amounts of data.
meanings.sent3: The mainframes had a party and processed the data with disco lights.
meanings.sent4: In the digital world, mainframes are the giants that crunch numbers tirelessly.
meanings.sent5: The mainframes hummed with power as they processed information at lightning speed.

meanings.definition: The central processing unit and primary memory of a computer.
meanings.sent1: Mainframes are like the brain and memory of a computer system.
meanings.sent2: When you turn on your computer, the mainframes kick into action.
meanings.sent3: The mainframes played memory games to keep themselves sharp.
meanings.sent4: In the world of computers, mainframes are the heart that keeps everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The mainframes stored and processed data with precision and speed.
